title: Source code export package guidance and tooling (frontend-only)

requirements.summary: Add a repeatable local export script that produces a single archive containing the complete repository contents (including frontend/public assets and generated assets).
acceptanceCriteria: A single downloadable source-code package is generated that contains the complete repository contents (e.g., backend/, frontend/, and any project config files that exist in the workspace).
The exported package can be extracted without errors and preserves the folder structure and filenames.
No source files are omitted from the export (including assets under frontend/public and any generated assets under frontend/public/assets/generated, if present).

file_operations.description: Create a POSIX shell script that packages the full repository into a single archive (including backend/, frontend/, and any existing repo-level config files) while preserving paths and filenames. Ensure the export includes frontend/public and frontend/public/assets/generated contents if present, and outputs a single artifact suitable for download/sharing.

Create an optional PowerShell export script that produces the same single-archive full-repository export on Windows, preserving structure and including frontend/public and any generated assets under frontend/public/assets/generated if present.

Document what the export script outputs (archive name/location), what it includes, and how to verify the archive contains backend/, frontend/, and static assets (including frontend/public/assets/generated if present).

requirements.summary: Add English documentation describing how to export the full source code from the workspace and how to run the frontend and Motoko backend locally, including where generated static assets live.
acceptanceCriteria: A new top-level documentation file exists (for example, EXPORT.md or SOURCE_CODE_EXPORT.md).
The documentation includes: prerequisites, local install steps for frontend, local deploy steps for the Motoko backend, and where to find the generated static assets.
All documentation text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create an English documentation file explaining: prerequisites; how to obtain/export a complete copy of the repository from the workspace (using the provided export script); how to install/run the frontend locally; how to deploy/run the Motoko backend locally; and where generated static assets are located (including frontend/public/assets/generated).

Update the export script to include the documentation file in the produced archive at a clearly discoverable location (preferably at the archive root) so the exported package contains export/run instructions.
